Reviews.Title: Inexpensive phone for international travel
Reviews.Author: G. Sherwood
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for a recent trip to France, along with a Telestial Passport Lite International SIM card with $5.00 Credit for 190 countries.  I only intended to use it for emergency phone calls, and I didn't need any frills.  Fortunately for me, but not so good for this review, there were no emergencies, so I didn't actually use it to make any calls, but I felt I should write up something to help others in a similar situation, to provide information on how to have a lifeline back home without spending a lot of money.  My US cell phone company doesn't do international roaming, so that wasn't an option.  It's possible to rent phones for international use that are already set up, but would have cost just as much or more as buying this phone and a sim card, and I would have to return it and pay for it again the next time I go overseas.  With this phone and sim card combination, I pay once and can use it for years to come.The instructions provided with the phone are wholly inadequate, and this is why I'm giving it only 4 stars.  The manufacturer didn't even see fit to indicate how to turn the phone on. Fortunately, in the end the set up wasn't difficult, and could be done at home, well before leaving for my trip. First, remove the back of the phone by inserting your thumbnail into a little groove at the bottom of the phone between the back case piece and the middle colored trim piece and prying it off. Then insert the sim card into sim slot 1 by sliding it under the metal retaining clip - the notch in one corner indicates the correct orientation, and your sim card will have a matching notch. Then put in the battery, put the back back on, and charge it for several hours (the instructions say 24 hours, but mine was fully charged in about 4 hours).  Once charged, I turned on the phone (see below), went through the setup for the sim card (which is specific to the sim card, so I won't describe that here), changed the ringtone and ringtone volume (see below), and was all set.  Not counting charging, the whole thing took maybe 20 minutes.As I mentioned, I didn't need to actually use the phone.  However, I did receive a text message as part of the process of setting up the sim card (no problem there and it was easy enough to figure out), and I did have the phone on the entire time I was in France.  The battery life was excellent - I didn't need to charge it at all the entire 10 days I was there, and by the end of the 10 days, the battery indicator only went down one notch, so it probably could have gone a few days more.  This is even more impressive because I don't wear a watch so I used it frequently to check the time (which uses power each time the screen comes on).  The screen was easy to read, and it seemed to have good reception - full bars in most places throughout the country, and the phone updated with the network I was on, so I know there was communication between the phone and the cell towers.  Sadly, I can't comment on actual call quality.Because of the lack of instructions, I copied and pasted some info that I found helpful from another review for the same phone but a different color (thanks to MichaelAngelo for providing it).Important buttons: center input button with left, right, up, down scrolling.soft keys - are above the answer and end call keys.Turn on/off: press and hold the end call key - release when on or off.Menu: shortcut press left soft key.Phone book: shortcut press right soft key.Flashlight on/off: shortcut press and hold center input button -release when on or off.Change language: press left soft key - scroll down to settings (wrench symbol) -scroll down to option 4 phone settings (Spanish/PortuguesConfiguracion del telefono) - scroll to option 2 language(Spanish/Portugues Idiorna) press center input button -scroll to English - Press center input button or OK.Speaker phone : press right soft key on - press right soft key again off.Vibrate on/off: press and hold # key (lower right corner).Lock keys: at home screen press and release center input button -then quickly press * key (lower left corner) a key symbolappears on screen. Repeat steps to unlock keys.(to answer a call in lock mode press the answer key).(to make a call the keys must be unlocked).Lock keys auto: press left soft key - scroll to settings (wrench symbol) -scroll to security settings - scroll to auto keypad lock -select auto lock setting (recommend 30 seconds or more).Voicemail: press and hold 1 key to set or check.Ringtone volume: at home screen press up scroll key - select general -select option 2 customize - scroll to option 4 (ringtone volume) -press center input button - scroll right or left toIncrease/decrease volume.

Reviews.Title: Travel phone
Reviews.Author: Traveller
Reviews.Content: We used the BLU Jenny as a travel phone for a recent trip to Spain. It is a great basic unlocked phone which hold can hold two Sims cards for greater savings while traveling abroad. We used a basic Orange Sim card that sells for 10 euros and another Sim for international calls. Public phones are awful in Spain. A basic phone is a must to keep in touch with others or for checking on hotel or restaurant reservations. A memory card is needed to store pictures on the phone. Also, the instructions for inserting the memory card can be improved. Overall, I was very pleased with my purchase of two phones for travel and I was very sad when one phone was accidentally left in a taxi. A European or universal adapter would be a bonus for recharging while abroad.

Reviews.Title: Easy - Convenient - Inexpensive
Reviews.Author: ann
Reviews.Content: This phone does everything I need a phone to do and a few extras.The nice extras:1. FM radio2. MP3 player3. Bluetooth4. 2 SIM card slots5. micro-USB charge/dataThe speakers are pretty loud. I listened to the radio on the beach and it was great.There is one strange con to this phone is that they did tried to save space by not putting in any headphone jack. I knew this was the case when I ordered it but didn't realize that it would be this hard to get around it. The music options are:1. Bluetooth headphones - so far not impressed with either sound or price. I got a pair of LG stereo headset for $60. Good for calls, music is terrible.UPDATE: the awful MP3 sound is not because of the headset but due to an old Bluetooth stack on the Phone. I experienced same sound on an old (6 yo) laptop but not on last year's Samusung Galaxy, that one sounded great.2. micro-USB to 3.5 adapter - proprietary so no guarantee that it will work. I am waiting on a Motorolla adapter in the mail. If it works, I'll update the review.UPDATE: this did not work3. micro-USB to a USB adapter to a USB gaming set. Have not explored this option but it could potentially work.Overall a nice phone for folks who don't want the data plan. Worked with A&TT; SIM card without problems.

Reviews.Title: How to install the SD card
Reviews.Author: Steve Richardson
Reviews.Content: Here is a trick to save time and frustration installing an SD card in this phone.DO NOT SLIDE the SD card under the silver metal retaining clip as instructed, you will bend the contacts. Instead, use a slight downward pressure on the clip and SLIDE it toward the center of the phone. When loose raise the clip and seat the SD card into position. Then reverse the process by sliding the retaining clip toward the outside of the phone until it snaps in place. Put the battery back in and snap back the case and you are good to go.

Reviews.Title: NO blues with my BLU phone
Reviews.Author: Danconnor
Reviews.Content: This phone I took on a trip to Europe.It was in expensive, no frills but I could call and receive calls and text no problem.I estimate it saved me 200-300 dollars at least in overseas calls having it.I recommend it as a decent, cost effective back up phone when  traveling abroad...Daniel Connor

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Anthony S. Novosel "pugachev"
Reviews.Content: I don't use my phone much and so I am on a Pay as You Go plan.  I just needed a basic phone that could easily do texts and calls. This fit the bill! I am very pleased with it.  i also travel to the UK a lot and so with the dual sim I am able to now just use the one phone in both countries.  If you are like me and you don't need a complicated phone, this is it!

Reviews.Title: BLU Jenny Phone
Reviews.Author: Ilan Duvdevani
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly sophisticated phone for its low price.  However, there are no instructions to use all the features that are available in the phone.

Reviews.Title: 2 SIMM option and Durable
Reviews.Author: Wm
Reviews.Content: Used this in Europe just fine.  2 SIMMS means you can easily travel between countries without changing SIMMS.. Each country needs a different SIMM card.  Also, accidentally ran this through the laundry wash.  It worked again after drying out the number pads and opening the back side to dry. Front screen took longer to dry in the sun.

Reviews.Title: Great EXCEPT I can't figure out how to get a MicroSD Card in it
Reviews.Author: Mrs. S
Reviews.Content: It looks nice, functions well, but I can't figure out how to get a MicroSD card into the back. There is a slot but my MicroSD card will not fit into the space. It only goes in about 1/4 of the way. I took apart the phone to put it in from the other side (the edge of the phone), but the phone didn't recognize that there was a MicroSD card in it. Can someone PLEASE help. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great for travel
Reviews.Author: Menomena
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to take on vacation to Spain for two weeks. Simple, easy to use, cheap. Just what I needed. When I got to Spain I stopped in a mobile shop and was able to get a prepaid SIM card for under $20. I didn't use it much, and didn't need to charge it at all during my two-week stay. I would recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Brendan Long
Reviews.Content: Pros:  * Small  * Buttons are big (helpful for texting)  * Long battery life  * Works on AT&T; or T-MobileCons:  * Very cheap feeling.  * MMS doesn't work at all (I get a message containing the raw MMS data, not the message itself). This was tested on Straight Talk on AT&T;'s network, with the correct MMSC settings.  * Predictive texting only works for Spanish and another language which I assume is Portuguese.  * Since MMS doesn't work, the only way to change the background is to take a picture or use an SD card to transfer it.Given the price, I would've rated this phone higher, but my Alcatel a510 was cheaper, and doesn't have these problems. I only switched to this one because I needed a phone that works on T-Mobile.

Reviews.Title: A unlocked GSM phone for worldwide travel
Reviews.Author: Amazon Reviewer1
Reviews.Content: This Blue  Jenny is a great simple to use Unlocked GSM phone. When we arrived in Italy we took it to the local cellphone carrier(be sure to have your passports or else they won't sell you a SIM card) and got the best pre-paid SIM Card loaded with minutes.  It was super easy to setup the phone and alarm clock. This phone will store all of your contacts.Having a Dual SIM card allows you to keep your American phone number or have two European phone numbers. The sound quality is perfect and the reception is great. For the price its better that I expected it and you don't have to pay the high US roaming charges.You could even use this phone on a pre-paid Tmobile or other GSM carrier in the USA. It supports all of the GSM bands. I would buy one for every traveling partner it gives you independence. Even a senior can learn how to setup the phone really quickly.You also have a calculator, FM radio tuner, Notepad and it even has a camera and voice recorder.

Reviews.Title: You need to find the product manual online
Reviews.Author: Norm DePlume
Reviews.Content: Good cheap phone. Instructions that come with it were totally inadequate, though -- you need to search online for the manual.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Sumit
Reviews.Content: Great for the price, works great, we took it to England and Netherlands and worked great.good reception always everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Worked great on a Canadian vacation
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Garrett
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone to use on a Canadian vacation to avoid roaming fees from my U.S.-based carrier. After crossing the border, I purchased a sim card with 60 minutes at a Petro Canada and it worked perfectly when we needed it. Now it is an inexpensive spare phone that only needs a prepaid sim and you are set to go.

Reviews.Title: No instruction manual of any value
Reviews.Author: patrick Morrison
Reviews.Content: I am fairly tech savvy, but had to read another owner's review to learn how to turn this product. Surprised Amazon even markets this item.Gave up trying to use it and will try to return it.Based on other reviews the product evidently can work well but for me it was total frustration.I bought the product for a europe trip and was enticed by its small size and dual sim chip capability.

Reviews.Title: Worked great in Costa Rica
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: It worked great in Costa Rica after I bought a new sim card in Costa Rica.  Great phone except for the camera.  It has a resolution of 320 X 240 but I don't really use that much.

Reviews.Title: Good Simple Phone
Reviews.Author: Lalaisme
Reviews.Content: My grandmother approached me to find her a simple phone because she couldn't understand the touch screen smart phones of today. I bought this phone for her and she has had no problems. I can't really say she loves it because there isn't really anything to love. Its simple a cell phone. No bells and whistles. It's a great value if you just need something to call a text a few people.

Reviews.Title: Used for trip to Balkans
Reviews.Author: Darius Hinton
Reviews.Content: Worked great! Battery life is awesome lasted the whole week with one charge! Could never figure out how to use app sharing features but mostly because the SIM cards we purchased were in different languages than our native English. Also this has 2 sim card slots and a spot for a mini SD card. Camera is decent but for the price overall this is a great product!

Reviews.Title: BLU T172
Reviews.Author: Jesse Shemen
Reviews.Content: Phone is perfectly adequate for foreign telephone use. Easy to convert to English language (it ships with Spanish). Torch function, instead of earphone, is a big plus. Used it as a flashlight on several occasions.Only problem was preventing inadvertent dialing. Otherwise simple phone with basic features.

Reviews.Title: Feels cheap and light, but works fine.
Reviews.Author: The German
Reviews.Content: For around $25 a nice cell phone. If you consider that it takes two SIMs it's a great price! Unpacked, SIMs inserted, charged and working - nice!

Reviews.Title: Nice little quad band phone
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for traveling overseas and being able to use it with foreign sim cards.It is a very basic phone, but that is the whole point of it. You just need one that can make calls.Call quality was good, although I haven't used it very much so hard to judge everywhere.I charged the phone before leaving for a week trip and never had to charge it.. the battery lasted the whole week. The phone was idle the whole time, but still, that is good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Its ok for a 20$ phone
Reviews.Author: bo173
Reviews.Content: Got this for as a temp phone for few days. Reception is not great with the other end caller complaining about stereo effect and voice cackling all the time. The headspeaker is not clear with words inchohernet sometimes. Ringtone is not loud and is difficult to make out. But the phone has a nice old world charm to it. Feels very light and easy to hold in hand.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Ardell
Reviews.Content: This phone worked great on our visit to Costa Rica.  Upon arriving to the country, I purchased a Simms card from an ICE store in Alahuela.  The card cost $6.oo and was good for around 88 minutes (local CR calls).  The Simms card is readily available throughout the country and can be recharged throughout the country.  I had great reception everywhere in the country and everybody that I called could hear me well.  I discovered that I could make calls back to the states but am unsure exactly how much the minutes cost.  The radio was fun to play with, light was nice.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Lucas
Reviews.Content: Great functionality and use for the money spent. Used a Swisscom prepaid SIM card in Switzerland and this worked great.

Reviews.Title: Great emergency phone for traveling
Reviews.Author: B. Jaynes "Indy99"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to have a phone overseas while traveling for work.  Worked great in Paris, France.  I rented a sim card with temp service.  It is cheap, but that is what I wanted.  Just something to call home with or to use for emergencies.

Reviews.Title: fine good excellent
Reviews.Author: Alexis Lira
Reviews.Content: good price good product good presentation i recommend the product you can buy it several times excellent bran and you can be confident

Reviews.Title: SERIOUSLY, DO **NOT** BUY
Reviews.Author: Madelyn Griffith-Haynie "MGHCoach4ADD"
Reviews.Content: I was mugged, hand smashed, and my phone stolen along with IDs, bank cards, everything else. I needed a "burner" phone PRONTO, so asked for the cheapest with a "no plan" option.  BAD idea!  ***Apparently the quality control is simply missing.*** Cellphones are always frustrating at first, but this phone is a total LEMON.It  has been a major frustration since I got it (at store, not Amazon, btw - couldn't use computer at time).  I rarely pan a product - generally don't review if I can't say *something* nice - but you REALLY don't want to take a chance on this phone, even if you have to pay a bit more.The ONLY nice thing I can say about the phone I got is that it is a little bit better than no phone at all - it works *sometimes.*-----------------UPDATE 4/14/14 - Starting in MARCH I began to have troubles charging it (2 months usage)  - by mid-month it was dead in the water -- would not even turn ON.-----------------A FEW of the frustrations===================1- the "manual" (a fold-out in teensy type) was only in Spanish. I speak English & purchased phone in Ohio.  Fortunately for me (after reading some of the other bad reviews), someone else set up the phone itself -- in English.2- the "help" text on the phone is less than worthless - tells me to plug in a "compatible headset," for example -- but where?  No clue - no port.  Can't find an online manual to help me (links returned in search engines 404).It took forever to click various menus to figure out how to set up a bluetooth headset on this particular phone -- you NEED a headset if you only have the use of one (non-dominant) hand!3- What's REALLY frustrating is that it doesn't seem to work the same way twice.  At first, I thought it was me, so I started writing things down (once my hand was healed enough to be able to scribble notes) -- NOPE.  Sometimes you have to press a key once, sometimes twice -- sometimes even three times.  The screen reflects what you are pressing, but it doesn't DO what it is supposed to do (like hang up, send, etc.)4- Even worse, the MENUs are screwy!!  Highlite an option and press a key, and it gives you the options for a different choice.  Repeat?  Sometimes it works, sometimes not.  Changing the ringer volume has been an Easter Egg hunt -- I go where I went last time & it's just not there.  Next time, it's somewhere ELSE.5- THEN there's the "call log" - simply a list of how many times a number has *ever* called me (or I, them), and you have to scroll through the list to see who has called LATELY.*Even* when I have input a name & number in the phones address book, it doesn't always pick up the name, and seems to see the caller as a separate being (with it's own count).  Sometimes it starts a new "count" when it DOES pick up the name. Good luck figuring out who's waiting for a call back unless you have a ton of time and patience.6- Moving right along to why you want a phone to begin with -- it won't stay connected.  Hangs up all by itself - sometimes 4 or more times in a 30-minute call,  Almost EVERY call -- that can't be the provider, nobody's that bad.6- I could go on - but why?  As the ADD Poster Girl, I'm not a fan of having to learning a new cellphone anyway, and generally stay well behind the "bleeding edge" until I'm forced to change -- but THIS one is the absolute worst phone experience I've had -- EVER!Cast just off, so I am *finally* able to begin to put everything stolen back in place and hook up my "real" cellphone and go back to my "real" provider (Verizon vs. Cincinnati Bell), thank you GOD!!!!Hope this review keeps the rest of you from having to go through MY experience.~~~~~xx,mgh(Madelyn Griffith-Haynie - ADDandSoMuchMore dot com)

Reviews.Title: Decent Phone (with Caveats)
Reviews.Author: AmazonBox@theDoor4Me
Reviews.Content: Great affordable compact phone. Dual SIM-capable, if needed. After repeated use, I may need to look for another for these reasons:1) Too small. Device is slick so it's a slippery phone. Every time I try to hit the # key the phone flies away from my hands. I suppose there is a thing as too small a phone. Easy to hold if you're talking. Not so easy to hold if you need to use the keypad.2) This phone is useless as a speakerphone in the car while while in motion. Unless you've Bluetooth'd the phone to your car you can't really hear the other party.3) No headphone jack. So if you can't use the speakerphone try the headphone jack. Oh wait, there is none.Thank goodness this isn't my primary phone.

Reviews.Title: perfect for travel
Reviews.Author: tyler h.
Reviews.Content: I hit multiple countries with this thing and it worked flawlessly, alarm and fm radio came in handy multiple times.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money.
Reviews.Author: Lori A. Brown "labrown"
Reviews.Content: We can't use the phone for any local carrier and really don't know who can use it. The phone has not been turned on.

Reviews.Title: Good for making and receiving calls while I was overseas
Reviews.Author: RJ
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that it has the capability of using two sim cards and the battery life is good. The phone allowed me to make and receive calls but it is not very intuitive.  I had a difficult time saving and finding stored numbers.

Reviews.Title: Blu Jenny
Reviews.Author: Patricia C. Paul
Reviews.Content: It's exactly what I expected. I wanted a simple phone that had Bluetooth, picture capability, and better reception than the one I had.The Jenny fills the bill. My carrier wanted me to wait 6 months to get a different phone as my contract was up for renewal then. But I was unhappy with the Pantech Breeze and wanted to change. This is a good phone!

Reviews.Title: Good travel phone.
Reviews.Author: TelcoBill
Reviews.Content: I've used this phone is Costa Rica, Italy and the UK. Sim card install is simple. Battery life is great.Pros: Inexpensive and works well. Flashlight is actually a nice plus. Call quality very good.Cons; Camera sinks...but c'mon you're not getting this for its camera.

Reviews.Title: Never worked and customer service is awful
Reviews.Author: ABY VARGHESE
Reviews.Content: The phone never worked for me and three of them that I bought are totally unusable outside USA.This is what I heard from customer service when asked for an update to the problem ticket."We are still working on the issue.  It may take more than 55 days to resolve this issue.Should you have any additional questions please contact us, via E-Mail or 1-877-602-8762 (Monday-Friday 9:30am-5:30pm EST).Thank you for choosing BLU!Best Regards,[...]"

Reviews.Title: Basic phone that works.
Reviews.Author: married2teensnomoney
Reviews.Content: I have only used the phone on a trip to Colombia where it worked flawlessly. Very small and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: Waste of my money.
Reviews.Author: R. DMELLO
Reviews.Content: I got this for India and it doesn't work! I tested the SIM card on another phone and it worked. So clearly it is a phone issue. It says " invalid SIM card" although I can still see the signal bars on it. What a waste! I could have bought a phone in India itself. But I thought this is good since it has dual SIM card option. I don't know if only this particular phone is a lemon; I haven't heard any one else have a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Sherrye S. Fuentes "Ayla Fan"
Reviews.Content: I sent this to a Pastor in Liberia, Africa - he loves it. Says it works beautifully and the camera & Bluetooth aspects are icing on the cake. For the price, you can't beat it.When he called me on it I was impressed by how clear the sound was. It actually sounded better than many callers I have connected with within the US. I just ordered another for his wife to use.I will mention that it has very little intrinsic memory, for storage of pictures for instance. I took one picture and it would not let me record a short message. I inserted a memory card and solved that problem.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Smith
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality and service in Germany and Italy! Bought prepaid SIM card at the airport in Munich the day I arrived and used it for talking to family in USA and it served its purpose for a very low cost! Pleasantly surprised at the sound quality!!

Reviews.Title: cheap plastic but keys are a good size
Reviews.Author: FJM
Reviews.Content: The phone does what we want it to do . If you are looking for flash this phone isn't it.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Solo
Reviews.Content: Rugged. Versatile. Easy to use. Full of features such as camera for a small device. Will work anywhere in the world with the right SIM card.

Reviews.Title: Used it going overseas
Reviews.Author: ALeeK.
Reviews.Content: Took this on an international trip. Used both Sim Slots and the phone worked perfectly. Texting is a pain. Multiple key presses to cycle through each number to get to the letter you want. Like the old days. Screen quality is nothing great. It has a VGA camera but I never used it.All in all for $27 for an unlocked phone,you can't go wrong. Worked flawlessly on overseas GSM networks. Used it as a prepay with no problems refilling etc. Battery lasts forever it seemed. Call quality pretty good. One thing I couldn't quite figure out was how to raise the volume. Minor issue as it was loud enough. Adding contacts takes a few more steps than normal. Minor issue.Its as basic as you can get but it works flawlessly. Makes calls and sends txts. For that price what more do you need?

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: prit
Reviews.Content: Very good for the money. Has been working well since I received it. I recommend it to others who want a basic cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for the price.
Reviews.Author: Yu Wang "Akuma888"
Reviews.Content: Since the phone is so tiny.  hoping there is a place allow you to connect a strap to the phone.  dual sim card feature was neat for a phone with this price. Battery tend to be warm after usage.Overall, It's not a smart phone but it does everything a phone needs to do.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't work in England - not worth the money
Reviews.Author: M Pence
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically for a trip to London from the US with my family and purchased a Telestial SIM card to go with it.  We also had two unlocked T-Mobile Samsung phones and two identical Telestial SIM cards to go with them.  None of the Telestial SIM cards would work with Jenny although all the SIMs worked in the Samsung phones.It was too late to return the phone when we got back from our trip.  Interestingly a US T-Mobile card worked in the Jenny when we returned but I don't need the phone in the US.The manual is also not written very well.  Couldn't find any troubleshooting tips in the maunal or information on what to do in the situation I was in.My daughter is going on a trip to Guatemala and I had planned on having her take this phone with an approriate SIM card, but now I'm worried that she will run into the same issues there.July 2013 update -- Didn't use it for the Guatemala trip.  Didn't want to spend the money for a SIM and then have it not work.

Reviews.Title: sorry it did not work
Reviews.Author: Bill Pontrello "vtywgp"
Reviews.Content: didn'twork  it turn in for awile then it turned off and it didn't work any more so i sent it back to you

Reviews.Title: all accessories were not sent.
Reviews.Author: Dilip Saha
Reviews.Content: It is good for using as it is low price, But problem is that all accessories were not  sent. online purchasing is a great problem of this.

Reviews.Title: Is there an English version?
Reviews.Author: eugene komosinski
Reviews.Content: Got the phone. User manual is useless. Type so small you need a magnifying glass to read. Phone is in spanish and no way to change language.

Reviews.Title: Phone was not as seen.
Reviews.Author: Janet Marie Hart "movie watcher"
Reviews.Content: What ever you look at a different phone this one isnt what it looks like, it is really small something you would give a child to play with. it is hard plastic. the numbers are small over all look forsomething that has some length and width.I would not recommand this phone to any one.

Reviews.Title: BLU JEN
Reviews.Author: Cherrie M.
Reviews.Content: it was not what i thought it would be as to the make of it.too toy looking and i made the mistake of ordering the international version and didnt understand the language it was programed with.

Reviews.Title: Bad guy!!!why die he alive ?
Reviews.Author: gûolinliwei1234
Reviews.Content: I shopping him 10 BLU T172 cell phone .But he send me only 1.Why? He is a lionYou such a big company can allow so have no credibility sellers continue to exist? Is not only my time, you waste money. And your credibility.

ProductInfo.Name: BLU JENNY T172I W/BT QUAD BAND DUAL SIM BLACK/BLUE
